messages.subject: Re: Your site description...question
messages.msgSnippet: Oooh, I hope they say yes, Kristen. :) I have been so happy to see the pa-unschoolers site get more and more unschooly lately.  It used to be that I didn t
messages.messageBody:
Oooh, I hope they say yes, Kristen. :)

I have been so happy to see the pa-unschoolers site get more and
more "unschooly" lately. It used to be that I didn't go there much
because it was more ecclectic/relaxed homeschooling, and the radical
unschooling ideas were sometimes not very popular! But that's been
slowly changing, and I'm very, very pleased! Thanks!

Sheila


--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, Have a Nice Day!
<litlrooh@c...> wrote:
> I was wondering if I could copy /paste your definition of what
unschooling is/isn't and put it on the Pa-unschoolers site
description as well. I will give credit to Unschoolingdot.com
>
>
> Thanks
> Kristen
> ****************************************************************
>
> Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a
gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.
>
> Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things
better than yesterday.
>
> The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth
living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we
can manage.
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Your site description...question
messages.msgSnippet: I was wondering if I could copy /paste your definition of what unschooling is/isn t and put it on the Pa-unschoolers site description as well.  I will give
messages.messageBody:
I was wondering if I could copy /paste your definition of what unschooling is/isn't and put it on the Pa-unschoolers site description as well. I will give credit to Unschoolingdot.com


Thanks
Kristen
****************************************************************

Today is even more important than tomorrow because "today" is a gift, and "tomorrow" might never come.

Today is where hope lives because today is when we can make things better than yesterday.

The only thing we can be sure of is today and life isn't worth living if it isn't lived in joy for as many moments of today as we can manage.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
